name: Pork and Chive Dumplings
instructions: Mise en Place:
Dumpling Filling
Thinly Slice 6-8 nappa cabbage leaves and place in a large bowl.
Salt cabbage generously with about 1-2 tablespoons of kosher salt.
Let sit for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile
Mince ½ a bunch of garlic chives.
Combine garlic chives with 1 pound of ground pork into a large bowl.
Peel and chop 1 Tablespoon of fresh ginger and combine with pork mixture in existing bowl.
Measure 2 teaspoons of sesame oil and add to pork mixture in existing bowl.
Measure 3 Tablespoons of soy sauce and add to pork mixture in existing bowl.
After 10 minutes elapsed, Squeeze cabbage to take all the water our and add to pork mixture in existing bowl.
Mix dumpling mixture well.
Dumpling Sauce
Measure ½ cup of soy sauce and put in a small bowl
Measure 1 Tablespoon of black Chiangking vinegar and put in existing small bowl with soy sauce.
Measure 2 teaspoons of siracha and put in existing small bowl with soy sauce mixture.
Measure 2 teaspoons of sesame oil and put in existing small bowl with soy sauce mixture.
Miscellaneous
Fill liquid measuring cup with ¾ cup of water
Making Dumplings
Place the dumpling wrapper on a flat surface.
Dip your finger in water and use to dab water all around the edge of the wrapper.
Put small spoonful of filling in center of wrapper.
Pinch in the middle to create taco-like shape.

Make two inward pleats at each end of the dumpling on the side of the wrapper facing away from you. The end result should resemble a small couch. (If you don’t want to cook them immediately, you can freeze them as long as you wrap them tightly.)
Repeat 1-5 until all the desired amount of dumplings is formed.
Preserve any remaining mixture of sheets.
Cooking Dumplings
Place oil in a large cast iron skillet and heat on high.
Add dumplings and immediately turn the heat down to medium-low
Cook, checking bottoms of dumplings, until golden brown (about 2-3 minutes).
Add about ¼ cup water to pan and cover immediately.
Let cook for a few minutes and add another ¼ cup of water when the water evaporates.
Cover and cook again.
Add one final ¼ cup of water and cover and cook again. Dumplings are done when the water completely evaporates and the bottoms are brown and crispy.
Serve with dumpling sauce.
Prepare Dumpling Sauce
Mix dumpling sauce ingredients together in a medium bowl. (May be made in advance.)
Makes: 50-60 dumplings
Joanne Chang
Chef Joanne Chang is the chef and owner of Myers + Chang and Flour Bakery. She shared this recipe with us when she was featured as our guest on Neighborhood Kitchens.
